com.parkingtycoon.controllers

Class CarsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.parkingtycoon.controllers.BaseController
      • com.parkingtycoon.controllers.UpdatableController
        • com.parkingtycoon.controllers.PathFollowersController<CarModel>
          • com.parkingtycoon.controllers.CarsController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Updatable

    public class CarsController
extends PathFollowersController<CarModel>
    This class is responsible for controlling the Cars in the simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CarsController

        public CarsController()

    • Method Detail

      • addCars

        private void addCars()
        This method will add cars to the simulation. It will decide how big the chances are that a new car is added. It will also decide what type the car will be. (AD_HOC, VIP or RESERVED) When a reserved-type car is added and a place is reserved, the car will not be spawned but after a certain time it will be.

      • spawnCar

        private void spawnCar(CarModel car)
        This method will make a car appear in the game-world and it will send it to an entrance.
        Parameters:
        car - The car that has to be spawned

      • reservePlace

        private boolean reservePlace()
        This method will search for an available place that can be reserved. If a place is found it will reserve the place and return true.
        Returns:
        Whether or not a place could be reserved.

      • update

        public void update()
        The update method will do several things: 1. Call the super.update() method. This will make the cars travel. 2. Call addCars(). This will add cars to the simulation. 3. Increase waitingTime so that other cars will avoid busy areas 4. Send cars to the exit 5. Make cars brake when they're colliding with other cars.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Updatable
        Overrides:
        update in class PathFollowersController<CarModel>

      • updateCarAABB

        private void updateCarAABB(CarModel car)
        This method will update the Axis Aligned Bounding Box of a car. The AABB is used to detect collisions with other cars.
        Parameters:
        car - The car

      • detectCollisions

        private void detectCollisions(CarModel car)
        This method will detect collisions with any other car. If a collision is detected, the method will decide which of the 2 cars have to brake.
        Parameters:
        car - The car you want to detect collisions for.

      • parkCar

        public boolean parkCar(CarModel car)
        This method will search for an available parking place, and send the car to it.
        Parameters:
        car - The car you want to park
        Returns:
        Whether or not an available place was found.

      • parkCar

        public boolean parkCar(CarModel car,
                       int fromX,
                       int fromY)
        This method will search for an available parking place, and send the car to it.
        Parameters:
        car - The car you want to park
        fromX - The x-position from where to calculate a path from
        fromY - The y-position from where to calculate a path from
        Returns:
        Whether or not an available place was found.

      • sendToParkingPlace

        private boolean sendToParkingPlace(CarModel car,
                                   int floor,
                                   int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int fromX,
                                   int fromY)
        This method will actually send a car to its parking place. If the car fails to arrive, the car will try again to find another parking place or drive to the exit.
        Parameters:
        car - The car that has to be send to a parking place
        floor - The floor that the parking place is on
        x - The x-coordinate of the parking place
        y - The y-coordinate of the parking place
        fromX - The x-position from where to calculate a path from
        fromY - The y-position from where to calculate a path from
        Returns:
        Whether or not a path could be calculated to the parking place

      • sendToExit

        public boolean sendToExit(CarModel car)
        This method will try to send a car to an exit. This method will also clear the parking space of the car.
        Parameters:
        car - The car that has to be send to the exit
        Returns:
        Whether or not an exit was found.

      • sendToEndOfTheWorld

        public boolean sendToEndOfTheWorld(CarModel car,
                                   boolean forced)
        This method will make a car drive to the end of the world. When arrived the car will despawn and be removed from the simulation.
        Parameters:
        car - The car that has to go away
        forced - If forced, the car will also despawn when no path could be found to the end of the world.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the car is going to despawn.

      • sendToEndOfTheWorld

        public boolean sendToEndOfTheWorld(CarModel car,
                                   int fromX,
                                   int fromY,
                                   boolean forced)
        This method will make a car drive to the end of the world. When arrived the car will despawn and be removed from the simulation.
        Parameters:
        car - The car that has to go away
        fromX - The x-position from where to calculate a path from
        fromY - The y-position from where to calculate a path from
        forced - If forced, the car will also despawn when no path could be found to the end of the world.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the car is going to despawn.

      • clearParkingSpace

        public void clearParkingSpace(CarModel car)
        This method will clear the parking space of a car
        Parameters:
        car - The car you want to clear the parking space of.

      • getPath

        protected java.util.List<PathFinder.Node> getPath(int floor,
                                                  int fromX,
                                                  int fromY,
                                                  int toX,
                                                  int toY)
        This method will ask the PathFinder for a path from point A to B When a path was found, the path will be repositioned so that cars drive on the right of the road.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        floor - On which floor
        fromX - From where
        fromY - From where
        toX - To where
        toY - To where
        Returns:
        The found path

      • onIdlesFloorChanged

        protected void onIdlesFloorChanged(CarModel pathFollower)
        This method is called when the floor underneath an idle car is changed. It will make the car drive away.
        Specified by:
        onIdlesFloorChanged in class PathFollowersController<CarModel>
        Parameters:
        pathFollower - The car

      • onTerrainChange

        public void onTerrainChange(int floorIndex,
                            java.lang.Boolean[][] tilesChanged)
        This method will make sure that cars won't park on a place that is not PARKABLE anymore. The method is called when the floor-layout changed
        Overrides:
        onTerrainChange in class PathFollowersController<CarModel>
        Parameters:
        floorIndex - The regarding floor
        tilesChanged - What tiles have changed?

      • repositionPath

        private void repositionPath(java.util.List<PathFinder.Node> path)
        This method will move the nodes of a path to the right side of the road, so that cars always drive on the right.
        Parameters:
        path - The path you want to reposition.
